questiontext.text:
Consider the signal x(t) defined as:
$$ x(t) = \begin{cases} -e^t, & t<0 \\ e^{-t}, & t\geq0 \end{cases} $$

The expression for the discrete signal x[n] obtained by sampling x(t) with period T, namely x[n] = x(nT) would be given by:
$$ x[n] = x(nT) = \begin{cases} -e^{nT}, & n<0 \\ e^{-nT}, & n\geq0 \end{cases} $$

Use T = 0.6 and N = 17 .

a) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the mean value of x[n]:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.029:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

b) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the variance of x[n]:
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.056:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

c) Calculate the mean and variance of x[n] when N→∞:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

$$

generalfeedback.text:
a) Average:
Sum of terms
= $$ \large - e^{(-17)T} - e^{-(16)T} - ... - e^{-0T}+ ... + e^{-16T} + e^{-17T} $$
= $$- \frac{1}{e^{17T}} - \frac{1}{e^{16T}} - ... - 1+ ... + \frac{1}{e^{16T}} + \frac{1}{e^{17T}} $$
= 1
No. of terms
= $$ 2N + 1 $$
$$ \large \bar{x} = \frac{\text{Sum of terms}}{\text{No. of terms}} = \frac{1}{2N + 1} = $$ 0.0286

b) The variance of x[n] is given by:
$$ Var(x) = \large \bar{x^2} - {\bar{x}}^2 $$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1}(1 + 2\sum_{{n}={1}}^{N} e^{-2nT} ) - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = $$ 0.0563

c) The mean and variance of x[n] as N→∞ are:
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} \bar{x} = \lim_{N \to \infty} \frac{1}{2N + 1} = 0 $$
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} Var(x) $$
$$ = \lim_{N \to \infty} [\frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}] = 0 $$

$$

Consider the signal x(t) defined as:
$$ x(t) = \begin{cases} -e^t, & t<0 \\ e^{-t}, & t\geq0 \end{cases} $$

The expression for the discrete signal x[n] obtained by sampling x(t) with period T, namely x[n] = x(nT) would be given by:
$$ x[n] = x(nT) = \begin{cases} -e^{nT}, & n<0 \\ e^{-nT}, & n\geq0 \end{cases} $$

Use T = 4.5 and N = 3 .

a) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the mean value of x[n]:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.143:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

b) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the variance of x[n]:
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.265:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

c) Calculate the mean and variance of x[n] when N→∞:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

$$

generalfeedback.text:
a) Average:
Sum of terms
= $$ \large - e^{(-3)T} - e^{-(2)T} - ... - e^{-0T}+ ... + e^{-2T} + e^{-3T} $$
= $$- \frac{1}{e^{3T}} - \frac{1}{e^{2T}} - ... - 1+ ... + \frac{1}{e^{2T}} + \frac{1}{e^{3T}} $$
= 1
No. of terms
= $$ 2N + 1 $$
$$ \large \bar{x} = \frac{\text{Sum of terms}}{\text{No. of terms}} = \frac{1}{2N + 1} = $$ 0.143

b) The variance of x[n] is given by:
$$ Var(x) = \large \bar{x^2} - {\bar{x}}^2 $$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1}(1 + 2\sum_{{n}={1}}^{N} e^{-2nT} ) - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = $$ 0.265

c) The mean and variance of x[n] as N→∞ are:
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} \bar{x} = \lim_{N \to \infty} \frac{1}{2N + 1} = 0 $$
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} Var(x) $$
$$ = \lim_{N \to \infty} [\frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}] = 0 $$

$$

Consider the signal x(t) defined as:
$$ x(t) = \begin{cases} -e^t, & t<0 \\ e^{-t}, & t\geq0 \end{cases} $$

The expression for the discrete signal x[n] obtained by sampling x(t) with period T, namely x[n] = x(nT) would be given by:
$$ x[n] = x(nT) = \begin{cases} -e^{nT}, & n<0 \\ e^{-nT}, & n\geq0 \end{cases} $$

Use T = 1.4 and N = 15 .

a) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the mean value of x[n]:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.032:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

b) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the variance of x[n]:
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.063:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

c) Calculate the mean and variance of x[n] when N→∞:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

$$

generalfeedback.text:
a) Average:
Sum of terms
= $$ \large - e^{(-15)T} - e^{-(14)T} - ... - e^{-0T}+ ... + e^{-14T} + e^{-15T} $$
= $$- \frac{1}{e^{15T}} - \frac{1}{e^{14T}} - ... - 1+ ... + \frac{1}{e^{14T}} + \frac{1}{e^{15T}} $$
= 1
No. of terms
= $$ 2N + 1 $$
$$ \large \bar{x} = \frac{\text{Sum of terms}}{\text{No. of terms}} = \frac{1}{2N + 1} = $$ 0.0323

b) The variance of x[n] is given by:
$$ Var(x) = \large \bar{x^2} - {\bar{x}}^2 $$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1}(1 + 2\sum_{{n}={1}}^{N} e^{-2nT} ) - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = $$ 0.0635

c) The mean and variance of x[n] as N→∞ are:
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} \bar{x} = \lim_{N \to \infty} \frac{1}{2N + 1} = 0 $$
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} Var(x) $$
$$ = \lim_{N \to \infty} [\frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}] = 0 $$

$$

Consider the signal x(t) defined as:
$$ x(t) = \begin{cases} -e^t, & t<0 \\ e^{-t}, & t\geq0 \end{cases} $$

The expression for the discrete signal x[n] obtained by sampling x(t) with period T, namely x[n] = x(nT) would be given by:
$$ x[n] = x(nT) = \begin{cases} -e^{nT}, & n<0 \\ e^{-nT}, & n\geq0 \end{cases} $$

Use T = 3.7 and N = 20 .

a) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the mean value of x[n]:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.024:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

b) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the variance of x[n]:
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.048:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

c) Calculate the mean and variance of x[n] when N→∞:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

$$

generalfeedback.text:
a) Average:
Sum of terms
= $$ \large - e^{(-20)T} - e^{-(19)T} - ... - e^{-0T}+ ... + e^{-19T} + e^{-20T} $$
= $$- \frac{1}{e^{20T}} - \frac{1}{e^{19T}} - ... - 1+ ... + \frac{1}{e^{19T}} + \frac{1}{e^{20T}} $$
= 1
No. of terms
= $$ 2N + 1 $$
$$ \large \bar{x} = \frac{\text{Sum of terms}}{\text{No. of terms}} = \frac{1}{2N + 1} = $$ 0.0244

b) The variance of x[n] is given by:
$$ Var(x) = \large \bar{x^2} - {\bar{x}}^2 $$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1}(1 + 2\sum_{{n}={1}}^{N} e^{-2nT} ) - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = $$ 0.0482

c) The mean and variance of x[n] as N→∞ are:
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} \bar{x} = \lim_{N \to \infty} \frac{1}{2N + 1} = 0 $$
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} Var(x) $$
$$ = \lim_{N \to \infty} [\frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}] = 0 $$

$$

Consider the signal x(t) defined as:
$$ x(t) = \begin{cases} -e^t, & t<0 \\ e^{-t}, & t\geq0 \end{cases} $$

The expression for the discrete signal x[n] obtained by sampling x(t) with period T, namely x[n] = x(nT) would be given by:
$$ x[n] = x(nT) = \begin{cases} -e^{nT}, & n<0 \\ e^{-nT}, & n\geq0 \end{cases} $$

Use T = 2.5 and N = 17 .

a) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the mean value of x[n]:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.029:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

b) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the variance of x[n]:
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.056:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

c) Calculate the mean and variance of x[n] when N→∞:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

$$

generalfeedback.text:
a) Average:
Sum of terms
= $$ \large - e^{(-17)T} - e^{-(16)T} - ... - e^{-0T}+ ... + e^{-16T} + e^{-17T} $$
= $$- \frac{1}{e^{17T}} - \frac{1}{e^{16T}} - ... - 1+ ... + \frac{1}{e^{16T}} + \frac{1}{e^{17T}} $$
= 1
No. of terms
= $$ 2N + 1 $$
$$ \large \bar{x} = \frac{\text{Sum of terms}}{\text{No. of terms}} = \frac{1}{2N + 1} = $$ 0.0286

b) The variance of x[n] is given by:
$$ Var(x) = \large \bar{x^2} - {\bar{x}}^2 $$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1}(1 + 2\sum_{{n}={1}}^{N} e^{-2nT} ) - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = $$ 0.0563

c) The mean and variance of x[n] as N→∞ are:
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} \bar{x} = \lim_{N \to \infty} \frac{1}{2N + 1} = 0 $$
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} Var(x) $$
$$ = \lim_{N \to \infty} [\frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}] = 0 $$

$$

Consider the signal x(t) defined as:
$$ x(t) = \begin{cases} -e^t, & t<0 \\ e^{-t}, & t\geq0 \end{cases} $$

The expression for the discrete signal x[n] obtained by sampling x(t) with period T, namely x[n] = x(nT) would be given by:
$$ x[n] = x(nT) = \begin{cases} -e^{nT}, & n<0 \\ e^{-nT}, & n\geq0 \end{cases} $$

Use T = 5 and N = 3 .

a) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the mean value of x[n]:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.143:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

b) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the variance of x[n]:
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.265:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

c) Calculate the mean and variance of x[n] when N→∞:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

$$

generalfeedback.text:
a) Average:
Sum of terms
= $$ \large - e^{(-3)T} - e^{-(2)T} - ... - e^{-0T}+ ... + e^{-2T} + e^{-3T} $$
= $$- \frac{1}{e^{3T}} - \frac{1}{e^{2T}} - ... - 1+ ... + \frac{1}{e^{2T}} + \frac{1}{e^{3T}} $$
= 1
No. of terms
= $$ 2N + 1 $$
$$ \large \bar{x} = \frac{\text{Sum of terms}}{\text{No. of terms}} = \frac{1}{2N + 1} = $$ 0.143

b) The variance of x[n] is given by:
$$ Var(x) = \large \bar{x^2} - {\bar{x}}^2 $$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1}(1 + 2\sum_{{n}={1}}^{N} e^{-2nT} ) - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = $$ 0.265

c) The mean and variance of x[n] as N→∞ are:
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} \bar{x} = \lim_{N \to \infty} \frac{1}{2N + 1} = 0 $$
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} Var(x) $$
$$ = \lim_{N \to \infty} [\frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}] = 0 $$

$$

questiontext.text:
Consider the signal x(t) defined as:
$$ x(t) = \begin{cases} -e^t, & t<0 \\ e^{-t}, & t\geq0 \end{cases} $$

The expression for the discrete signal x[n] obtained by sampling x(t) with period T, namely x[n] = x(nT) would be given by:
$$ x[n] = x(nT) = \begin{cases} -e^{nT}, & n<0 \\ e^{-nT}, & n\geq0 \end{cases} $$

Use T = 3.7 and N = 8 .

a) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the mean value of x[n]:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.059:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

b) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the variance of x[n]:
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.114:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

c) Calculate the mean and variance of x[n] when N→∞:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

$$

generalfeedback.text:
a) Average:
Sum of terms
= $$ \large - e^{(-8)T} - e^{-(7)T} - ... - e^{-0T}+ ... + e^{-7T} + e^{-8T} $$
= $$- \frac{1}{e^{8T}} - \frac{1}{e^{7T}} - ... - 1+ ... + \frac{1}{e^{7T}} + \frac{1}{e^{8T}} $$
= 1
No. of terms
= $$ 2N + 1 $$
$$ \large \bar{x} = \frac{\text{Sum of terms}}{\text{No. of terms}} = \frac{1}{2N + 1} = $$ 0.0588

b) The variance of x[n] is given by:
$$ Var(x) = \large \bar{x^2} - {\bar{x}}^2 $$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1}(1 + 2\sum_{{n}={1}}^{N} e^{-2nT} ) - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = $$ 0.114

c) The mean and variance of x[n] as N→∞ are:
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} \bar{x} = \lim_{N \to \infty} \frac{1}{2N + 1} = 0 $$
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} Var(x) $$
$$ = \lim_{N \to \infty} [\frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}] = 0 $$

$$

questiontext.text:
Consider the signal x(t) defined as:
$$ x(t) = \begin{cases} -e^t, & t<0 \\ e^{-t}, & t\geq0 \end{cases} $$

The expression for the discrete signal x[n] obtained by sampling x(t) with period T, namely x[n] = x(nT) would be given by:
$$ x[n] = x(nT) = \begin{cases} -e^{nT}, & n<0 \\ e^{-nT}, & n\geq0 \end{cases} $$

Use T = 4.4 and N = 5 .

a) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the mean value of x[n]:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.091:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

b) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the variance of x[n]:
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.174:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

c) Calculate the mean and variance of x[n] when N→∞:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

$$

generalfeedback.text:
a) Average:
Sum of terms
= $$ \large - e^{(-5)T} - e^{-(4)T} - ... - e^{-0T}+ ... + e^{-4T} + e^{-5T} $$
= $$- \frac{1}{e^{5T}} - \frac{1}{e^{4T}} - ... - 1+ ... + \frac{1}{e^{4T}} + \frac{1}{e^{5T}} $$
= 1
No. of terms
= $$ 2N + 1 $$
$$ \large \bar{x} = \frac{\text{Sum of terms}}{\text{No. of terms}} = \frac{1}{2N + 1} = $$ 0.0909

b) The variance of x[n] is given by:
$$ Var(x) = \large \bar{x^2} - {\bar{x}}^2 $$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1}(1 + 2\sum_{{n}={1}}^{N} e^{-2nT} ) - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = $$ 0.174

c) The mean and variance of x[n] as N→∞ are:
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} \bar{x} = \lim_{N \to \infty} \frac{1}{2N + 1} = 0 $$
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} Var(x) $$
$$ = \lim_{N \to \infty} [\frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}] = 0 $$

$$

Consider the signal x(t) defined as:
$$ x(t) = \begin{cases} -e^t, & t<0 \\ e^{-t}, & t\geq0 \end{cases} $$

The expression for the discrete signal x[n] obtained by sampling x(t) with period T, namely x[n] = x(nT) would be given by:
$$ x[n] = x(nT) = \begin{cases} -e^{nT}, & n<0 \\ e^{-nT}, & n\geq0 \end{cases} $$

Use T = 2 and N = 16 .

a) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the mean value of x[n]:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.030:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

b) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the variance of x[n]:
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.060:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

c) Calculate the mean and variance of x[n] when N→∞:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

$$

generalfeedback.text:
a) Average:
Sum of terms
= $$ \large - e^{(-16)T} - e^{-(15)T} - ... - e^{-0T}+ ... + e^{-15T} + e^{-16T} $$
= $$- \frac{1}{e^{16T}} - \frac{1}{e^{15T}} - ... - 1+ ... + \frac{1}{e^{15T}} + \frac{1}{e^{16T}} $$
= 1
No. of terms
= $$ 2N + 1 $$
$$ \large \bar{x} = \frac{\text{Sum of terms}}{\text{No. of terms}} = \frac{1}{2N + 1} = $$ 0.0303

b) The variance of x[n] is given by:
$$ Var(x) = \large \bar{x^2} - {\bar{x}}^2 $$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1}(1 + 2\sum_{{n}={1}}^{N} e^{-2nT} ) - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = $$ 0.0597

c) The mean and variance of x[n] as N→∞ are:
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} \bar{x} = \lim_{N \to \infty} \frac{1}{2N + 1} = 0 $$
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} Var(x) $$
$$ = \lim_{N \to \infty} [\frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}] = 0 $$

$$

Consider the signal x(t) defined as:
$$ x(t) = \begin{cases} -e^t, & t<0 \\ e^{-t}, & t\geq0 \end{cases} $$

The expression for the discrete signal x[n] obtained by sampling x(t) with period T, namely x[n] = x(nT) would be given by:
$$ x[n] = x(nT) = \begin{cases} -e^{nT}, & n<0 \\ e^{-nT}, & n\geq0 \end{cases} $$

Use T = 3.7 and N = 15 .

a) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the mean value of x[n]:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.032:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

b) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the variance of x[n]:
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.063:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

c) Calculate the mean and variance of x[n] when N→∞:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

$$

generalfeedback.text:
a) Average:
Sum of terms
= $$ \large - e^{(-15)T} - e^{-(14)T} - ... - e^{-0T}+ ... + e^{-14T} + e^{-15T} $$
= $$- \frac{1}{e^{15T}} - \frac{1}{e^{14T}} - ... - 1+ ... + \frac{1}{e^{14T}} + \frac{1}{e^{15T}} $$
= 1
No. of terms
= $$ 2N + 1 $$
$$ \large \bar{x} = \frac{\text{Sum of terms}}{\text{No. of terms}} = \frac{1}{2N + 1} = $$ 0.0323

b) The variance of x[n] is given by:
$$ Var(x) = \large \bar{x^2} - {\bar{x}}^2 $$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1}(1 + 2\sum_{{n}={1}}^{N} e^{-2nT} ) - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = $$ 0.0635

c) The mean and variance of x[n] as N→∞ are:
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} \bar{x} = \lim_{N \to \infty} \frac{1}{2N + 1} = 0 $$
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} Var(x) $$
$$ = \lim_{N \to \infty} [\frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}] = 0 $$

$$

Consider the signal x(t) defined as:
$$ x(t) = \begin{cases} -e^t, & t<0 \\ e^{-t}, & t\geq0 \end{cases} $$

The expression for the discrete signal x[n] obtained by sampling x(t) with period T, namely x[n] = x(nT) would be given by:
$$ x[n] = x(nT) = \begin{cases} -e^{nT}, & n<0 \\ e^{-nT}, & n\geq0 \end{cases} $$

Use T = 1.7 and N = 4 .

a) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the mean value of x[n]:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.111:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

b) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the variance of x[n]:
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.210:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

c) Calculate the mean and variance of x[n] when N→∞:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

$$

generalfeedback.text:
a) Average:
Sum of terms
= $$ \large - e^{(-4)T} - e^{-(3)T} - ... - e^{-0T}+ ... + e^{-3T} + e^{-4T} $$
= $$- \frac{1}{e^{4T}} - \frac{1}{e^{3T}} - ... - 1+ ... + \frac{1}{e^{3T}} + \frac{1}{e^{4T}} $$
= 1
No. of terms
= $$ 2N + 1 $$
$$ \large \bar{x} = \frac{\text{Sum of terms}}{\text{No. of terms}} = \frac{1}{2N + 1} = $$ 0.111

b) The variance of x[n] is given by:
$$ Var(x) = \large \bar{x^2} - {\bar{x}}^2 $$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1}(1 + 2\sum_{{n}={1}}^{N} e^{-2nT} ) - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = $$ 0.21

c) The mean and variance of x[n] as N→∞ are:
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} \bar{x} = \lim_{N \to \infty} \frac{1}{2N + 1} = 0 $$
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} Var(x) $$
$$ = \lim_{N \to \infty} [\frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}] = 0 $$

$$

Consider the signal x(t) defined as:
$$ x(t) = \begin{cases} -e^t, & t<0 \\ e^{-t}, & t\geq0 \end{cases} $$

The expression for the discrete signal x[n] obtained by sampling x(t) with period T, namely x[n] = x(nT) would be given by:
$$ x[n] = x(nT) = \begin{cases} -e^{nT}, & n<0 \\ e^{-nT}, & n\geq0 \end{cases} $$

Use T = 1.5 and N = 7 .

a) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the mean value of x[n]:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.067:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

b) If n ∈ [-N,N], with N being a positive integer, calculate the variance of x[n]:
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.129:0.01~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

c) Calculate the mean and variance of x[n] when N→∞:
$$ \Large \bar{x} $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}
$$ Var(x) $$ = {1:NUMERICAL:=0.000:0~%0%999999:0#Good job!!~*#Incorrect, try again}

$$

generalfeedback.text:
a) Average:
Sum of terms
= $$ \large - e^{(-7)T} - e^{-(6)T} - ... - e^{-0T}+ ... + e^{-6T} + e^{-7T} $$
= $$- \frac{1}{e^{7T}} - \frac{1}{e^{6T}} - ... - 1+ ... + \frac{1}{e^{6T}} + \frac{1}{e^{7T}} $$
= 1
No. of terms
= $$ 2N + 1 $$
$$ \large \bar{x} = \frac{\text{Sum of terms}}{\text{No. of terms}} = \frac{1}{2N + 1} = $$ 0.0667

b) The variance of x[n] is given by:
$$ Var(x) = \large \bar{x^2} - {\bar{x}}^2 $$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1}(1 + 2\sum_{{n}={1}}^{N} e^{-2nT} ) - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = \large \frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}$$
$$ = $$ 0.129

c) The mean and variance of x[n] as N→∞ are:
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} \bar{x} = \lim_{N \to \infty} \frac{1}{2N + 1} = 0 $$
$$ \lim_{N \to \infty} Var(x) $$
$$ = \lim_{N \to \infty} [\frac{1}{2N + 1} + \frac{2}{2N+1}\frac{e^{-2T}(1-e^{-2NT})}{1-e^{-2T}} - \frac{1}{(2N + 1)^2}] = 0 $$

$$
